story:
Once upon a time, in the beautiful land of Vietnam, there lived a little owl named Mai. Mai was known for her cleverness and wisdom. Every night, she would fly around the forests and fields, sharing her knowledge with all the animals she met.

One evening, as the sun set and the moon rose high in the sky, Mai landed on a tree branch near a cozy village. She noticed a young rabbit named Linh huddled by a tree, looking worried.

"Hello, little one. Why do you look so troubled?" Mai asked kindly.

Linh blinked back tears and explained that she was afraid of the dark and the unknown sounds of the night. Mai smiled gently and said, "Fear not, dear Linh. The world may seem scary at night, but there is beauty and wonder in the darkness too. Let me show you."

Mai led Linh through the forest, pointing out the twinkling stars in the sky and the fireflies dancing among the trees. She showed her how the moon bathed everything in a soft, silver light, turning the night into a magical wonderland.

As they walked, Mai shared stories of bravery and friendship, teaching Linh that there was nothing to fear when she had courage in her heart and friends by her side.

By the time they returned to the village, Linh's fear had melted away, replaced by a sense of wonder and excitement for the night ahead. She thanked Mai for her guidance and curled up in her burrow, drifting off to sleep with a smile on her face.

From that night on, Linh no longer feared the darkness, knowing that the night held its own kind of beauty and magic. And every evening, Mai would visit her, sharing more stories and wisdom, guiding her through the wonders of the world.

And so, under the watchful eye of the wise owl Mai, Linh learned to embrace the night, finding peace and joy in the darkness, just as she did in the light.

The end. Good night, my dear. Sweet dreams.
